commit c862ef8858a7f8b398971097f11def4fa36a193c
Author: Victor J. Orlikowski <orlikowski@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Mar 10 05:52:38 2003 +0000

    Commit patch to get us compiling under CVS of Rhino, and release 1.5r4.
    Patch submitted by Igor Bukanov <igor_ml@fastmail.fm>
    
    Unfortunately, this patch does break compatibility with previous versions
    of Rhino; a branch may have to occur here to support those versions, or we
    may need to recall these files prior to this patch, and set up
    a choice of debug interface, based upon version of Rhino being compiled
    against.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/bsf/trunk@180400 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 113ccefacb44d694f6dced16debc47d87c5c8bfd
Author: Victor J. Orlikowski <orlikowski@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Nov 4 07:55:44 2003 +0000

    Ran into an interesting problem w/ Jython and double byte character sets.
    Seems that Jython prefers to be fed strings as a set of bytes, if it
    is to handle these character sets correctly.
    
    Note well, we do need the loop involving the ByteArrayInputStream;
    getBytes() won't cut the mustard, in this instance.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/bsf/trunk@180414 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

Author: Victor J. Orlikowski <orlikowski@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Jun 14 17:08:21 2004 +0000

    Fix a build break in the Rhino engine; The EvaluatorException constructor
    using a string argument only is now class protected, which means that we
    must use the public constuctor. However, the public constructor requires
    source and line number information...which makes no sense inside of a
    call(). Punting for now...

commit 59b15d72e698e3b499ae5d3e8832a23cada73d08
Author: Victor J. Orlikowski <orlikowski@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 9 06:29:37 2004 +0000

    *Sigh*. Mess up in previous commit message.
    Dan Schwarz has provided us w/ a means of automatically registering engines,
    by providing an org.apache.bsf.Languages.properties file in the jar containing
    the language engine. Simply ensuring jar is in the classpath will register the
    engine.
    
    Submitted by: Dan Schwarz
    Reviewed by: Victor Orlikowski <orlikowski@apache.org>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/bsf/trunk@180445 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit ca15edf34efb14dac2667933d43e175454379fb8
Author: Rony Flatscher <rony@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Dec 16 12:15:45 2006 +0000

    20061216 1214 This solution creates a BSF_LogFactory and BSF_Log class which will by default behave as an no-op logger. In case commons-logging LogFactory and Log is available, it will be used. Hence the functionality remains the same, but the change will allow BSF to run without commons-logging present (possibly easying installation issues considerably). A build of BSF incorporating all these changes can be downloaded from <http://wi.wu-wien.ac.at/rgf/tmp/bsf.tmp/>
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/bsf/trunk@487795 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 44d4758e7c626491a914503194eea64a80291e9a
Author: Anthony Elder <antelder@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Oct 26 16:42:24 2007 +0000

    Change trunk version to be 3.0-SNAPSHOT as thats what the trunk code is currently working towards, update test code for the recent addition of NoSuchMethodException on the Invocable interface, fix Groovy dependency as a duff pom.xml got added to the groovy repo, and add some missing dependencies used in the Ant build tasks. The trunk code should now be building ok
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/bsf/trunk@588706 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit a257ef6eaf0c7aa834ed342cdd77d1ac749cc1db
Author: Arnout Engelen <arnout@bzzt.net>
Date:   Fri Jan 24 12:41:39 2025 +0100

    fix indent in `.asf.yaml`
    
    This seems to cause problems already - I got a notification email
    that cryptically says:
    
    ```
    An error occurred while running notifications feature in .asf.yaml!:
    Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
    ```
    
    We will soon migrate to https://github.com/apache/infrastructure-asfyaml/
    which uses https://hitchdev.com/strictyaml/. I checked and indeed
    strictyaml also requires this indent level.
